header.title: Esoteric Extension of Tarot to Develop Supersensory Powers

central_thesis: The development of supersensory powers and a deeper spiritual understanding is achieved by recognizing the divine nature of the physical form and its experiences, and by harmonizing mental and emotional responses to manifest a higher reality.

structure_content.summary: This lesson focuses on understanding consciousness, its interpretation of experiences based on past knowledge, and how it withdraws from physical form upon death. It emphasizes that the physical world is a spiritual reality and that true beauty lies in inner goodness rather than outward appearance. The text also introduces the concept of the body as a 'temple of God' and the importance of spiritualizing the physical vehicle through conscious intent and action, culminating in a specific meditation technique related to Tarot Key 18.

key_concepts.definition: The faculty that interprets experiences based on past knowledge. It withdraws from physical form upon death and is in a state of disciplining itself to deepen awareness and develop powers.
Considered the electromagnetic substance holding form. It is as real as any other experience of consciousness and is seen as a divine manifestation ('holy ground').
Defined not by conventional physical standards but by inner goodness, lovingness, kindness, and tenderness, which emanates from the soul and spiritual essence.
The process of making the physical body ('vehicle') etherealized and divine through higher attitude, realization, and by letting the Higher Self guide. This leads to an increase in inner beauty.
The divine name for the Lord used for the plane of earth, specifically referring to the physical plane as the tenth Sephirah (Malkuth). The body is seen as the miraculous garment of this divine name.
The secret to spiritual growth and transformation. It involves conscious direction and manifestation on the physical plane, driven by the mind and ensouling force.

Represents 'yesterday' or the past. The associated exercise involves blessing all past experiences and forms as essential steps towards present self-conscious humanity and destiny, helping to overcome negative habit patterns.

practical_system.description: The practical system focuses on transforming one's perception and relationship with the physical world and one's own body. It advocates for recognizing the divine essence in all forms, including the physical body, which is termed the 'temple of God' or 'garment of Adonai ha-Eretz'. This transformation is achieved through conscious mental and emotional re-alignment, intentional 'spiritualization' of the body, and consistent, mindful action. The ultimate goal is to develop supersensory powers and achieve higher spiritual evolution by integrating spiritual awareness with physical existence.
tools: Tarot Key 18 (The Moon) for visualization and reflection exercises.
The 'mind' and 'heart' as integrated tools for perceiving and harmonizing reality.
The physical body ('vehicle') as the primary instrument for spiritualization and manifesting higher consciousness.
rituals: Meditative visualization related to Tarot Key 18 (The Moon) to bless past experiences and integrate them into present growth.

Affirmations and conscious pronouncements during daily activities, such as during bathing ('I am washing the temple of the living God'), eating, or sleeping ('I now lovingly pull the sheets about this tender, beloved, body of the Lord of Life').
Inhaling deeply with the intention of 'inhaling the body of Adonai'.
Practicing action-oriented exercises mentally and physically to manifest desired outcomes.

relevant_quotes.text: Consciousness interprets whatever happens to us, and these interpretations are dependent upon past experience.
Nevertheless, the state of concentration that holds the electromagnetic substance in form is the physical world. It is no more unreal than any other experience of consciousness.
We must begin to see the physical world for what it really is, see it as a reality, and that means seeing our own bodies and all other bodies as divine. Whatever you touch is holy ground.
Be careful to not despise your Lord in human form, as we do constantly, by setting ourselves standards of what is beautiful and what is unbeautiful.
The vehicle is meant to be SPIRITUALIZED.

Action is the secret. That is why you see the Path on the Key. It must be part of your Path of Return. You cannot simply sit inertly and dream within your mind. The mind must be the ensouling force that drives the body into doing and into being.
We must know it both ways, with the mind and with the heart. This is what we mean by bringing the mental and the emotional responses into harmony with what is.
You must learn to see your body as the miraculous garment of Adonai ha-Eretz, that name for the Lord used for the plane of earth.
For instance, when you take a bath or a shower, and are soaping yourself, say to yourself, "I am washing the temple of the living God."

As you picture yourself seeing this, say to yourself, "This represents, symbolically, my yesterday. I have come through the waters of consciousness onto the Path, through form after form; controlling, directing, and then evolving the ability to handle the next type of form, unto my present estate of self-conscious humanity, aware of myself as I, reaching consciously toward the beyond that is my destiny. Whatever I have been or done or felt, on the Path, which I have ascended, has been essential to bring me to my present place. I therefore bless it. I bless it!"

critical_analysis.relevance: This text represents a post-New Age, spiritual interpretation of occult principles, strongly influenced by teachings similar to those of Theosophy and the Ascended Masters. It integrates concepts of consciousness, spiritual evolution, and the divine nature of the material world, framed within a Tarot context. Its relevance lies in its attempt to bridge esoteric philosophy with practical self-development, emphasizing the sacredness of the physical form and personal experience, which contrasts with ascetic or purely spiritualist approaches that might devalue the material.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary audience appears to be students or practitioners of esoteric disciplines who are seeking to develop supersensory abilities and achieve spiritual mastery. This includes individuals interested in Tarot, consciousness studies, and metaphysical teachings, particularly those who are open to or already engaged with the idea of embodiment as a spiritual practice and who are familiar with teachings that emphasize the divine in all forms.
